title: Here is a reading list of 20 articles up to 2020 focusing on multi-modal dialogue grounding and its application in dialogue systems and conversational agents

author.literal: **"Deep Reinforcement Learning for Dialogue Generation"** - Li, Jiwei, et al.

title: This paper explores the use of deep reinforcement learning for generating dialogues, emphasizing the importance of context and grounding

**"Multimodal Machine Learning: A Survey and Taxonomy"**
A comprehensive survey of multimodal machine learning, including applications in dialogue systems

container-title: **"End-to-End Multimodal Dialog Systems with Hierarchical Multimodal Attention"**

author.literal: **"Towards a Neural Conversational Model"** - Vinyals, Oriol, and Quoc V. Le

title: An early influential paper on neural network-based conversational models, discussing the potential for multimodal grounding

author.literal: **"Multimodal Conversational Search and Recommendation"** - Radlinski, Filip, and Nick Craswell

title: This paper discusses the integration of multimodal inputs for improving search and recommendation systems in conversational agents
**"Learning to Ground Visual Objects for Visual Dialog"**
This paper focuses on grounding visual objects in the context of visual dialogue tasks
**"Multimodal Dialogue State Tracking for Shopping Assistants"**

**"Multimodal Sentiment Analysis: Addressing Key Issues and Setting Up the Baselines"**
Discusses the challenges and methodologies for multimodal sentiment analysis, relevant for dialogue systems

author.literal: **"Deep Contextualized Word Representations"** - Peters, Matthew E., et al.

title: While not exclusively about multimodal grounding, this paper introduces ELMo, which has implications for context-aware dialogue systems

author.literal: **"Multimodal Fusion for Video Search"** - Snoek, Cees GM, et al.

title: An early work on multimodal fusion techniques, applicable to dialogue systems that process video content
**"Multimodal Transformer Networks for End-to-End Video-Grounded Dialogue Systems"**
This paper presents a transformer-based approach for integrating video and text in dialogue systems
**"Grounded Language Learning in a Simulated 3D
